intro: Sphaeranthus laevigatus, commonly known as the smoothleaf globe flower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are smooth and fleshy, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a globular shape. It is often found in rocky soils and can be used in traditional medicine in some regions.
